In Washington, Donald Rumsfeld was known as a tenacious and effective fighter of policy wars, once described by Henry Kissinger as a skilled full-time politician-bureaucrat in whom ambition, ability, and substance fuse seamlessly. In the 1970s, as chief of staff and then defense secretary in the Gerald Ford administration, Donald Rumsfeld clashed with Henry Kissinger , then secretary of state, with Donald Rumsfeld opposing- and helping to prevent, by many accounts-
